Classical.Structure: The region of the cerebral cortex (primarily in the occipital lobe) that processes visual information. Includes the Primary Visual Cortex (V1) and higher-level visual areas (V2, V3, etc.).
Classical.Function: Receives the L2 visual data stream from the D3.Brain.Thalamus (LGN). V1 detects basic features (edges, orientation, color). Higher areas (V2+) assemble these features into complex shapes and objects.
Classical.Pathology: Cortical blindness, visual agnosia (inability to recognize objects).

SCPN.L2_NeurochemicalNeurological: The 'L2 Visual Processor'. This is where L2 raw data from the Thalamus is processed into L2 'feature data'.
SCPN.L3_GenomicEpigeneticMorphogenetic: L3 plasticity (LTP/LTD) in V1 is critical for learning to see during development.
SCPN.L4_CellularTissueSynchronisation: L4 Gamma oscillations in V1 are hypothesized to be the 'binding' mechanism that glues features (e.g., 'red' and 'square') together.
SCPN.L5_OrganismalPsychoemotional: This is the 'L5 Visual Qualia Generator'. The L4/L2 processing in this area *is* the L5 experience of 'sight'. (Ref: Paper 5)
SCPN.L7_ArchetypalSymbolic: Interprets L7 symbolic/geometric information (e.g., 'seeing' archetypal forms).
SCPN.L9_MemoryHolograph: The D4.DMN (L6) queries this area to 'visualize' L9 memories.
SCPN.L16_MetaCybernetic: The L16 'I=Model(I)' loop makes 'predictions' about 'what I will see next', and this area (V1) compares that prediction to the L2 signal from the Thalamus. 'Surprise' (a mismatch) is sent up as prediction error.

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The 'Mind's Eye' or 'Canvas' where L2 sensory data is painted into L5 conscious experience.
